Description: Valley of the Tombs of the Queens; sharp ridge of rocks looking across deep hollow filled with darkness to opposite crags, summits of which are flushed with warm light from sunset, moon rising above. 1839 Watercolour Verso; Sketch of Valley; with rocky mound rising in centre, flanked by bare cliffs Graphite
Bibliographic references: Binyon 1898-1907 / Catalogue of drawings by British artists, and artists of foreign origin working in Great Britain (34)
Exhibition history: 1983 May-July, Brighton Art Gallery, 'Egypt & The British', no. 289 1983 Aug-Sep, Manchester Art Gallery, 'Egypt & The British', no. 289 1988 April-June, Liverpool, Walker Art Gallery, The East Imagined, (no cat.) 1991 Sept-Nov, Bristol Art Gallery, 'Muller', no. 103 1994 Aug-Nov, Edinburgh, Scottish NPG, Visions of the Ottoman Empire (no cat.)
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
